principles.name: One Idea Per Slide
principles.description: Each slide should convey a single, central idea or question. Break down complex ideas into manageable pieces.

principles.name: Concise Text & No Cognitive Overload
principles.description: Use words sparingly as 'guide posts,' avoiding full sentences. Prefer bullet points (max 4 per slide) and short phrases. Optimize for listening, not reading. Limit total elements on a slide to 6 or less.

principles.name: Visual Hierarchy & Readability
principles.description: Use clear headings (# for main sections, ## for slide titles). Employ size, color, and placement to guide attention and emphasize important points. Utilize ample white space, consistent alignment, and high contrast between text and background.

principles.name: Effective Use of Visuals
principles.description: Prioritize images over text when possible, using high-quality, relevant visuals to support content. Use `data-background-image` for impactful backgrounds and `r-stretch` for images/videos that fill available space.

principles.name: Engagement & Interactivity
principles.description: -->` or `::: {.incremental}`) for incremental revealing of content. Employ transitions and animations sparingly and purposefully to enhance understanding.

principles.name: Consistency & Repetition
principles.description: Maintain consistent fonts, colors, and layouts throughout the presentation. Use a consistent design template and include branding elements (logos) consistently.

principles.name: Distraction-Proof Design
principles.description: Design slides so that the main takeaway is clear even if the audience is distracted. Title slides with major conclusions.
